title: Blue Origin reaches orbit on first flight of its titanic New Glenn rocket
summary: Bypassing engine chill issues and a wayward boat, Blue Origin got to T-0.

title: New Glenn reaches orbit on first launch
summary:
Blue Origin’s New Glenn rocket achieved orbit on its long-awaited first launch Jan. 16, although the company failed in its attempt to recover the first stage.
The post New Glenn reaches orbit on first launch appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Second SAR satellite advances Space42’s hybrid connectivity and imagery vision
summary:
Emirati operator Space42 has established communications with its recently launched Foresight-2 satellite, the second SAR payload for the hybrid imaging and connectivity provider.

title: Hubble budget cuts could impact science and mission operations
summary:
Proposed budget reductions for the Hubble Space Telescope would impact research and outreach as well as increase the risk to the observatory.

title: NASA Solar Observatory Sees Coronal Loops Flicker Before Big Flares
summary: For decades, scientists have tried in vain to accurately predict solar flares — intense bursts of light on the Sun that can send a flurry of charged particles into the solar system. Now, using NASA’s Solar Dynamics Observatory, one team has identified flickering loops in the solar atmosphere, or corona, that seem to signal when […]

title: Langley’s Propeller Research Tunnel
summary: Elton W. title: NASA Seeks Proposals for Space Biology and Physical Sciences Research
summary: On Dec. 19, 2024, NASA released two amendments to the NASA Research Announcement Research Opportunities in Space and Earth Sciences (ROSES) 2024 (NNH24ZDA001N) to announce the E.9 Space Biology: Research Studies and E.12 Physical Sciences Research Studies program elements.   Space Biology Proposals  The research emphases of E.9 Space Biology: Research Studies fall under two broad […]
